item.title: Windows 11 KB5077181 fixes boot failures linked to failed updates
item.description: Microsoft says it has resolved a Windows 11 bug that caused some commercial systems to fail to boot with an "UNMOUNTABLE_BOOT_VOLUME" error after installing recent security updates, with the fix delivered in the February 2026 Patch Tuesday update. [...]

item.title: Google patches first Chrome zero-day exploited in attacks this year
item.description: Google has released emergency updates to fix a high-severity Chrome vulnerability exploited in zero-day attacks, marking the first such security flaw patched since the start of the year. [...]

item.title: Microsoft Weekly: Windows 11's taskbar is upgrading, better Task Manager alternatives, more
item.description: Catch up with this week's Microsoft stories in our weekly recap, including long-anticipated taskbar fixes in Windows 11, updates, and more. Read more...

item.title: Microsoft released KB5077180, KB5077374, KB5076124 Windows 11 setup & recovery updates
item.description: Microsoft this week released new dynamic updates for Windows 11 26H1, 25H2 and 24H2 under KB5077178, KB5077180, KB5077374, and KB5076124 for setup and recovery. Read more...

item.title: Microsoft confirms 8.8-rated security issue in Windows 11 Notepad due to modernization efforts, Patch Tuesday fix rolling out
item.description: Microsoft has confirmed a Remote Code Execution vulnerability (CVE-2026-20841) in Windows 11’s modern Notepad app. The flaw allows attackers to exploit malicious Markdown links to execute code in the user’s security context. The post Microsoft confirms 8.8-rated security issue in Windows 11 Notepad due to modernization efforts, Patch Tuesday fix rolling out appeared first on Windows Latest

item.title: Passwords to passkeys: Staying ISO 27001 compliant in a passwordless era
item.description: Password-based authentication is increasingly risky as organizations adopt passkeys to strengthen security and meet ISO/IEC 27001 requirements. Passwork explains how to align passwordless adoption with Annex A controls, risk assessments, and secure implementation practices. [...]

item.title: Microsoft Edge is getting a new feature that will be loved by IT admins
item.description: Microsoft is testing a new Edge trick for enterprises that could change how browser updates reach your workplace PC. Read more...

item.title: Microsoft says Windows 11 update causes BSOD on some GPU config, broke WPA3 Wi‑Fi, but a fix is rolling out
item.description: Microsoft says it is aware of two separate issues that could affect some Windows 11 installs, including a fatal bug that crashes PCs. The post Microsoft says Windows 11 update causes BSOD on some GPU config, broke WPA3 Wi‑Fi, but a fix is rolling out appeared first on Windows Latest

item.title: Microsoft pushes back “switch to MacBook” for a compact adapter, says Surface has slim chargers too in a viral X post
item.description: A viral post comparing a MacBook charger to an old Windows brick sparked backlash, but the comparison ignored how most modern Windows laptops already use compact USB-C adapters. The post Microsoft pushes back “switch to MacBook” for a compact adapter, says Surface has slim chargers too in a viral X post appeared first on Windows Latest

item.title: Former Microsoft executive claims he "fought hard" to keep this Windows 11 feature, but lost
item.description: Ex-Microsoft executive reveals the drama behind what really happened to a fan-favorite feature in Windows 11. Read more...

item.title: Rufus blames Microsoft for allegedly blocking latest Windows 11 ISO downloads
item.description: Microsoft has seemingly blocked Windows 11 ISO downloads for certain users as it may be trying to get them to only use the official way. Read more...

item.title: Windows 11 may finally let you move and resize the taskbar in 2026 as Microsoft responds to user feedback
item.description: Microsoft is reportedly preparing to restore one of the most requested features in Windows 11 the ability to move the taskbar to the top or sides of the screen. Alongside this change, the company is also working on taskbar resizing. The update is expected as part of Microsoft’s broader 2026 improvements. The post Windows 11 may finally let you move and resize the taskbar in 2026 as Microsoft responds to user feedback appeared first on Windows Latest

item.title: Microsoft begins pushing Microsoft 365 Copilot on macOS if you use fresh installs of Microsoft 365 suite enterprise
item.description: Microsoft is moving ahead with its plans to push Microsoft 365 Copilot to more customers on macOS, mostly enterprises. The post Microsoft begins pushing Microsoft 365 Copilot on macOS if you use fresh installs of Microsoft 365 suite enterprise appeared first on Windows Latest

item.title: Former Bing boss says Windows 11 killed the vertical taskbar for symmetric UX, says it was the best productivity feature
item.description: Former Bing boss says Microsoft cut Windows 11’s vertical taskbar for its “symmetric panes” design, calling it the best productivity feature. The post Former Bing boss says Windows 11 killed the vertical taskbar for symmetric UX, says it was the best productivity feature appeared first on Windows Latest

item.title: Microsoft under fire for allegedly pushing OEMs to exclusively bundle Edge in Windows PCs
item.description: Microsoft is in hot water again as regulators check if its Jumpstart program nudges PC makers to favor Edge over other browsers. Read more...

item.title: Microsoft introduces new security tool for IT admins managing AI infrastructure
item.description: Microsoft just dropped a new command center for AI security, promising tighter control and clearer insight for teams without adding extra cost. Read more...

item.title: Microsoft blocks a way for user sign-in on Windows 11 25H2 24H2, and for good reason
item.description: Microsoft has recently blocked a convenient way to sign-in or authenticate on all Windows 11 versions as well as on 10. The company has explained why. Read more...

item.title: Microsoft réserve Windows 11 version 26H1 aux machines Arm sorties cette année
item.description: Microsoft a précisé mardi le plan de déploiement de Windows 11 version 26H1. Contrairement aux mises à jour annuelles classiques programmées sur le deuxième semestre de l’année, cette version attendue au printemps se destine à un périmètre matériel limité : celui des machines équipées de processeurs Arm sorties en 2026, à commencer par le Snapdragon […]

item.title: Eurail says stolen traveler data now up for sale on dark web
item.description: Eurail B.V., the operator that provides access to 250,000 kilometers of European railways, confirmed that data stolen in a breach earlier this year is being offered for sale on the dark web. [...]

item.title: Man arrested for demanding reward after accidental police data leak
item.description: Dutch authorities arrested a 40-year-old man after he downloaded confidential documents that had been mistakenly shared by the police and refused to delete them unless he received "something in return." [...]

item.title: Save 84% on an OnlineDrive Cloud Storage: Lifetime Subscription
item.description: Everything you need to store, manage and share your files! 1TB storage, 100+ file previews, team workspaces, enterprise security, and 99.9% uptime. Read more...

item.title: Siemens et son PDG veulent tout automatiser grâce à l'IA
item.description: Siemens, sous l'impulsion de son PDG Roland Busch, s'engage dans une transformation majeure visant à automatiser l'ensemble des processus industriels. En combinant hardware et software, l'entreprise mise sur les jumeaux numériques et une nouvelle génération d'IA industrielle pour optimiser les usines, de la conception à la production, posant ainsi les bases d'une nouvelle ère manufacturière.

item.title: Infostealer malware found stealing OpenClaw secrets for first time
item.description: With the massive adoption of the OpenClaw agentic AI assistant, information-stealing malware has been spotted stealing files associated with the framework that contain API keys, authentication tokens, and other secrets. [...]

item.title: Firefox 147.0.4 fixes blank new tab page and one security issue
item.description: Firefox 147 has received yet another bug-fixing update to address bugs with the new tab page and a single security issue. Read more...

item.title: CISA gives feds 3 days to patch actively exploited BeyondTrust flaw
item.description: CISA ordered U.S. government agencies on Friday to secure their BeyondTrust Remote Support instances against an actively exploited vulnerability within three days. [...]

item.title: New ClickFix attack abuses nslookup to retrieve PowerShell payload via DNS
item.description: Threat actors are now abusing DNS queries as part of ClickFix social engineering attacks to deliver malware, making this the first known use of DNS as a channel in these campaigns. [...]

item.title: Save 70% on a PDF Converter Pro lifetime license with updates included
item.description: Convert PDF from and to Word, Excel, PPT, TXT, Image, and more, efficiently and accurately. Read more...

item.title: CTM360: Lumma Stealer and Ninja Browser malware campaign abusing Google Groups
item.description: CTM360 reports 4,000+ malicious Google Groups and 3,500+ Google-hosted URLs used to spread the Lumma Stealer infostealing malware and a trojanized "Ninja Browser." The report details how attackers abuse trusted Google services to steal credentials and maintain persistence across Windows and Linux systems. [...]

item.title: Pastebin comments push ClickFix JavaScript attack to hijack crypto swaps
item.description: Threat actors are abusing Pastebin to distribute a new ClickFix-style attack that tricks cryptocurrency users into executing malicious JavaScript in their browser, allowing attackers to hijack Bitcoin swap transactions and redirect funds to attacker-controlled wallets. [...]

item.title: 7 Days: Too much Instagram is not addiction, Windows 95 CD, 30 years of Rayman, and more
item.description: Our '7 Days' weekly tech roundup brings the juiciest announcements. Read about the Windows 95 CD, Galaxy S26, WF-1000XM6, and some tech drama. Read more...

item.title: Windows 11 KB5077181 fixes gaming bugs, Nvidia black screen, and performance issue affecting explorer.exe, taskbar, and Start menu
item.description: KB5077181 could make some PCs faster if explorer.exe was hanging on your system, and it also fixes the black screen issue on Nvidia GPUs. item.title: One threat actor responsible for 83% of recent Ivanti RCE attacks
item.description: Threat intelligence observations show that a single threat actor is responsible for most of the active exploitation of two critical vulnerabilities in Ivanti Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM), tracked as CVE-2026-1281 and CVE-2026-1340. [...]

item.title: Snail mail letters target Trezor and Ledger users in crypto-theft attacks
item.description: Threat actors are sending physical letters pretending to be from Trezor and Ledger, makers of cryptocurrency hardware wallets, to trick users into submitting recovery phrases in crypto theft attacks. [...]

item.title: Claude LLM artifacts abused to push Mac infostealers in ClickFix attack
item.description: Threat actors are abusing Claude artifacts and Google Ads in ClickFix campaigns that deliver infostealer malware to macOS users searching for specific queries. [...]

item.title: How to resize the Start menu in Windows 11?
item.description: Windows 11 recently got a brand-new, redesigned Start menu. One thing is missing, though: resizability. Read more...

item.title: Guide: What is the Windows.old folder and can I delete it?
item.description: Is your storage suddenly shrinking after a Windows upgrade? There's a hidden reason most people miss, and it could be quietly eating tens of gigabytes. Read more...

item.title: How to check if Windows 11 has applied the new Secure Boot 2023 certificates (replaces Secure Boot 2011)
item.description: Windows 11’s February 2026 update begins replacing aging 2011 Secure Boot certificates with the newer Windows UEFI CA 2023, which is triggering TPM-WMI Event Viewer logs like Event ID 1801, that look alarming but are actually part of a staged rollout designed to avoid failures to firmware. The post How to check if Windows 11 has applied the new Secure Boot 2023 certificates (replaces Secure Boot 2011) appeared first on Windows Latest

item.title: Tested: Windows 11 can now pick up your Spotify session from Android, similar to Apple Handoff for iOS
item.description: Windows 11 Resume feature is now integrating Spotify for cross-device playback functionality to transfer the music playback session from your Android phone to your Windows 11 PC. The post Tested: Windows 11 can now pick up your Spotify session from Android, similar to Apple Handoff for iOS appeared first on Windows Latest

item.title: Ingérences numériques étrangères : VIGINUM doté de « moyens renforcés »
item.description: VIGINUM annonce pouvoir collecter les données issues des petites plateformes où sont souvent pensées les opérations de manipulations contre la France, relève l’AFP. Un décret, présenté hier en Conseil des ministres et publié ce 12 février au Journal officiel, dote en effet le service de vigilance et de protection contre les ingérences numériques étrangères de […]
